channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Financial Freedom in 3 Years by Investing in “Boring” Rental Properties
item.description: Can rental properties replace your W2 income, lead you to financial freedom, and help you build multimillion-dollar wealth in the process? Yes, and Grant Francke is proof you can do […]

item.title: US border agents must get warrant before cell phone searches, federal court rules
item.description: Critics have long argued that wararantless device searches at the U.S. border are unconstitutional and violate the Fourth Amendment. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: What These Decisions Tell Us About Kamala Harris’ Approach to Criminal Justice
item.description: From the death penalty to school truancy and diversion programs, here are some key steps Harris took as a district attorney and attorney general.

item.title: Recession “Yellow Flags” Emerge as Unemployment Metric Rises w/The Washington Post’s Heather Long
item.description: One of the most reliable recession indicators, the “Sahm Rule,” just issued a “yellow flag” for the economy. Even now, with low unemployment, high spending, and overall economic growth, we […]

item.title: UK’s Zapp EV plans to expand globally with an early start in India
item.description: Zapp is launching its urban electric two-wheeler in India in 2025 as it plans to expand globally. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Love Beyond Bars: Raymond and Cassandra
item.description: Raymond Flanks spent nearly 39 years in Louisiana lockups for a murder he didn’t commit. Luckily, he found love with an old friend, Cassandra Delpit.

item.title: House Flipping 101: How to Find Deals, Vet Contractors, & Manage a Rehab
item.description: Every real estate deal is hard work, whether your investing strategy is house flipping, buy and hold, or even wholesaling. If your goal is to not only get a great […]

item.title: Dear Google, who wants an AI-written fan letter?
item.description: The first time I saw Google’s latest commercial, I wondered, “Is it just me, or is this kind of bad?” By the fourth or fifth time I saw it, I’d stopped wondering. It starts innocuously enough, with a father talking about how much his daughter loves Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone (she “might even be the world’s number […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: The Problem With Labeling Trump a ‘Felon’
item.description: Here’s why language used to describe any person convicted of crimes matters, and affects more than the former president.

item.title: My Tenant Was Airbnbing Their Apartment Without Me Knowing. It Happens More Than You Think.
item.description: Renting has its horror stories, and sometimes it gets out of control. Jeff gives us an inside look at what happened when one of his tenants rented out his property without him knowing, plus stories from other landlords.

item.title: MatPat, the first big YouTuber to successfully exit his company, is lobbying for creators on Capitol Hill
item.description: Though MatPat retired from YouTube, he’s still pretty busy. In fact, he’s been spending a lot of time on Capitol Hill. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Photos: Three Years of a Family’s Grief and Healing After a Fatal Police Shooting
item.description: Photographer Michael Indriolo documents an East Cleveland family’s search for peace after the 2021 police shooting of their 19-year-old brother.

item.title: Mortgage Rate Gaps: Tracking the States With the Tightest Lock-In Effects
item.description: With higher interest rates, the lock-in effect has created a low inventory environment. Homeowners in these states are the most locked-in.

item.title: A tale of two foldables
item.description: Samsung is still foldables’ 500-pound gorilla, but the company successes have made the category significantly less lonely in recent years. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Sending Unarmed Responders Instead of Police: What We’ve Learned
item.description: There are more than 100 response teams nationwide, but experts say more research on their impact is needed.
